biography.value:
“In the case of the mausgeist, the pursuit of power corrupts in ways only a fiend knows.”

Fiendish Rodent.

A mausgeist appears when a powerful spellcaster makes an infernal pact for immortality. Magic imbues each of a mausgeist's long whiskers, making the creature a deadly opponent.

A mausgeist hungers for humanoid flesh, wandering cemeteries at night to dig up hearts and livers to feast upon. Breaking the curse of a mausgeist's existence requires it to refrain from killing or devouring humanoid flesh for a thousand days.

Shifty Appearance.

A mausgeist can change its appearance through magical means. The creature retains some rodent characteristics even in humanoid form.

Jungeist.

A jungeist is a mausgeist before any pact gives it more power. This fiend is still a formidable foe, but it's easier to dispatch than a mausgeist.

Salvage p212[–]

A mausgeist is a creature born of a hunger for undying power. Its remains can be harvested for their magical properties. Within the liver of a mausgeist is a @item[pearl of power].

Someone who has proficiency with @item[leatherworker's tools|PHB] or @item[weaver's tools|PHB] can incorporate the hide of a mausgeist into a @item[cloak of the mausgeist|GHMG] [...]. Doing so requires 10 days of work, extra materials worth 2,000 gp, and a successful [[/save ability=intelligence dc=15]] (&Reference[skill=Arcana]) check.

Lore p212[–]

[[/save ability=intelligence dc=10]] (&Reference[skill=Arcana]):

A mausgeist is a fiend immune to poison and resistant to weapons that aren't silvered.

[[/save ability=intelligence dc=15]] (&Reference[skill=History]):

A mausgeist can take humanoid form, but it still resembles a rodent in such a disguise. Even in that form, each of the fiend's whiskers can create a magical effect.

languages.custom: understands Abyssal but can't speak; telepathy 60 ft.

description.value: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+6]]{+6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 ([[/damage 1d4 type=piercing]]) damage and 13 ([[/damage 3d8 type=psychic]]) damage.

The mausgeist uses two of the following effects at random on one or two creatures the mausgeist can see within 90 feet of it. It can use each whisker only once per turn.

  • @UUID[Actor.KtQcEeJYoUfvTpm9.Item.D0nTiWbiXMh8cuMd]{Eldritch Bolt}
  • @UUID[Actor.KtQcEeJYoUfvTpm9.Item.J45mIYcJDE9RVO9G]{Fear Blast}
  • @UUID[Actor.KtQcEeJYoUfvTpm9.Item.1BB0fZFo9TS3NPPe]{Fire Orb}
  • @UUID[Actor.KtQcEeJYoUfvTpm9.Item.537pceyNtv9Dssin]{Gripping Shadows}
  • @UUID[Actor.KtQcEeJYoUfvTpm9.Item.6cqRCLB5hrlBlUQ6]{Hungry Shadows}
  • @UUID[Actor.KtQcEeJYoUfvTpm9.Item.vrW4VhdnETcdt9J4]{Hypnotic Phantasm}
The target must succeed on a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=15]] saving throw or take 22 ([[/damage 4d10 type=force]]) damage.

The target must succeed on a [[/save ability=wisdom dc=15]] saving throw or be &Reference[condition=frightened] of the mausgeist for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the target is aware of the mausgeist, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The target must succeed on a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=15]] saving throw or take 21 ([[/damage 6d6 type=fire]]) damage.

The target must succeed on a [[/save ability=strength dc=15]] saving throw or be &Reference[condition=grappled] by shadowy tendrils (escape DC 15) for 1 minute and &Reference[condition=restrained] while &Reference[condition=grappled] in this way.

The target must make a [[/save ability=constitution dc=15]] saving throw. On a failure, shadowy tendrils deal the target 18 ([[/damage 4d8 type=necrotic]]) damage and render it unable to take reactions until the end of the mausgeist's next turn. If the save succeeds, the target takes half the damage but no other effect.

The target must succeed on a [[/save ability=intelligence dc=15]] saving throw, or a scintillating phantasm only it sees renders it &Reference[condition=charmed] by the mausgeist for 1 minute. While &Reference[condition=charmed] in this way, the creature is &Reference[condition=incapacitated] and has a speed of 0. The effect ends if the target takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the target out of the stupor.
The mausgeist has advantage on Wisdom (&Reference[skill=Perception]) checks that rely on hearing.

The mausgeist can use its action to polymorph into a form that resembles a Small humanoid or back into its true form. Other than its size, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
